issue.title: CMake Error - C++14 support for the library

content.raw:
The CMake error that you posted seems to indicate that it was attempting to compile with `4.9.4` which would be consistent with the problem that it's reporting (variable template feature not being available). You might want to check which version of gcc your computer is set up to use. You could perhaps uninstall `4.9.4` to force your computer to use `5.4.1`. If you don't actually have `4.9.4` installed at all, then something very strange must have happened with cmake.

I'm going to mark this issue as resolved. If you can determine for certain that the cmake error is occurring while it's trying to build with gcc version 5+, then we can reopen it.

The CMake error that you posted seems to indicate that it was attempting to compile with 4.9.4 which would be consistent with the problem that it's reporting (variable template feature not being available). You might want to check which version of gcc your computer is set up to use. You could perhaps uninstall 4.9.4 to force your computer to use 5.4.1. If you don't actually have 4.9.4 installed at all, then something very strange must have happened with cmake.

I'm going to mark this issue as resolved. If you can determine for certain that the cmake error is occurring while it's trying to build with gcc version 5+, then we can reopen it.
